physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressures: 89/52/67 mm Hg (pulmonary), 69/37/50 mm Hg (systemic)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Echocardiography showed a hypertrophied right ventricle and secondary tricuspid regurgitation with a systolic gradient of 100 mm Hg. Left ventricle small with internal dimension in diastole of 22 mm; mean diastolic gradient across minimal regurgitant mitral valve 8 mm Hg.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After an uneventful period of 4 months following surgical intervention, the patient was seen in improved clinical condition.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A precordial systolic murmur was audible. Echocardiography revealed mild apical displacement of the tricuspid valve, indicating mild Ebsteinâ€™s anomaly with moderate tricuspid valve insufficiency and right heart enlargement.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 11 days of age, the baby was symptomatic with poor feeding, pallor, and poorly perfused, with tachypnea and tachycardia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Coarctation of the aorta was identified by differences in blood pressures between upper and lower limb.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The child underwent repair of the atrial septal defect and ventricular septal defect, but heart failure symptoms did not improve.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient continued to have echocardiographic features of left ventricular noncompaction with abnormal myocardial relaxation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient is doing well with normal growth and development.
